titleStmt.title: Edward D. Townsend, Special Orders, No. 238
CWG12090

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.collection: 1st - 20th Regiments Kentucky Infantry Primary Source Documents

body.p:
WAR DEPARTMENT,
ADJUTANT GENERAL's OFFICE,
Washington, May 18th, 1865.
SPECIAL ORDERS,
No. 238.}
(Extract.)

19. So much of the sentence of the General Court Martial, convened by Special Orders, No. 5, Headquarters, U. S. Forces, Morganzia, Louisiana, of July 12th, 1864, in the case of Private James M. Gilbert, 7th Kentucky Veteran Volunteers, (formerly Company "D," 22d Kentucky Volunteers,) as requires him to make good the time lost by absence without leave, is remitted.

By order of the Secretary of War:
E. D. TOWNSEND,
Assistant Adjutant General.

OFFICIAL:
E D Townsend
Assistant Adjutant General.

22 Infy
7" Vet Inf
late D 22d Inf
Gilbert James M.
Private
Order
remitting sentence of Court Martial which makes good time lost by absence without leave.
